title: Strictly pro Janette Manrara's screams after partner Will Bayley's horror fall
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly pro dancer Janette Manrara was heard screaming “no no no!” as her celebrity partner Will Bayley suffered a nasty fall during rehearsals hours before the live show.

Shocking behind the scenes extended footage obtained by The Sun shows the Paralympian screaming out in agony as he lands badly on his right leg after jumping off a table.

The video was shot as the sportsman was rehearsing his jive routine with Strictly pro Nancy Xu, with his pro partner Janette looking on from the sidelines.

As the 31-year-old fell to a heap on the floor, Janette can be heard screaming “no, no, no” as she rushes to his side, visibly distraught.

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

Footage taken on a mobile phone reveals the moment of Will’s accident and shows the table tennis star writhing around in agony as medics rush to his aide.

He is also heard loudly screaming out in pain, as Nancy places a comforting hand on Janette’s head.

Will’s injury saw him miss this weekend’s Halloween special show, with a small clip from the aftermath of the incident screened ahead of his slot.

In a follow-up video message, the table tennis champion said: "I jumped off a table and as I landed, I landed with straight legs. I thought I'd broke my leg as I'd never felt anything like that before.

"But fortunately its not as severe as what I thought when I first did it."

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

He added: "To hear the words 'I absolutely can’t dance' was really gutting for me but I need to recover now and come back even stronger next week."

After Will's message, presenter Claudia Winkleman spoke to heartbroken Janette about her injured partner.

Giving an update on his condition, Janette said: "Well he’s obviously a bit gutted he couldn’t be with us dancing the jive that he absolutely loved all week. He’s at home on icing, taking care of himself and resting.

"Fingers crossed he comes back next week. Will, I love you, if you’re watching you know my heart is with you."

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

A Strictly spokesperson said: “Sadly, Will Bayley was injured during training and medics have said he cannot dance in the show this weekend.

"Under the rules of Strictly Come Dancing , Will has been granted a bye to next week.

"Separately, Alex Scott’s partner Neil Jones received an injury whilst training this morning. Kevin Clifton has stepped in to partner Alex in tonight’s show."

description: The Paralympian was forced to pull out of the Halloween special after injuring his leg during Strictly Come Dancing's pre-show rehearsals
